children.name: book
children.definition: a set of sheets of paper held together in a cover so that you can write on them: sổ
examples: a black address book
a notebook

children.name: book
children.definition: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them: cuốn sách
examples: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
book about/on
a book about cats
book by
a book by Charles Dickens
book of somethinga book containing several examples of the same kind of writing
She wrote a book of short stories, but it never got published.
library booka book that you borrow from a library
I went and got a library book about it.
secondhand booka book that has already been owned by someone else
a secondhand book dealer

children.name: read a book
examples: What book are you reading at the moment?

children.name: look through a book
children.definition: look at the pages quickly
examples: I looked through the book until I found the right section.

children.name: write a book
examples: He’s written several interesting travel books.

children.name: publish a book
examples: The book is published by Penguin.

children.name: a book comes out
children.definition: it is published for the first time
examples: Everyone was waiting for the new Harry Potter book to come out.

children.name: borrow a book
children.definition: alsotake out a bookBritish English
examples: (= from a library )You can borrow up to six books from the library.

children.name: return a book
children.definition: to a library
examples: Please return all your books before the end of term.

children.name: renew a book
children.definition: arrange to continue borrowing it from a library
examples: If you need to renew a book, you can do it by phone.

children.name: a book shop
children.definition: alsobook storeAmerican English
examples: I got it from that little book shop in the village.

children.name: a book seller
children.definition: a person, shop, or company selling books
examples: High street book sellers are experiencing a drop in sales.

children.name: a book tokenBritish English
children.definition: a ticket that you can use to pay for a book
examples: She always bought me book tokens for my birthday.

children.name: a book review
children.definition: an article giving critical opinions of a book
examples: She had a book review published in the student magazine.

children.name: a book fair
children.definition: an event at which publishers and authors show new books

children.name: the introduction/preface/foreword to a book
examples: In the introduction to this book I referred to a conversation between myself and a young student.

children.name: a section of a book
examples: The most useful section of the book is the list of suppliers of artists’ materials.

children.name: the cover of a book
examples: His picture is on the cover of the book.

children.name: a chapter of a book
examples: The first chapter of the book is about his childhood.

children.name: notebook
children.definition: a book of plain paper or paper with lines, for writing on: cuốn tập
examples: She was jotting things down in a little notebook.

children.name: notepad
children.definition: a set of sheets of plain or lined paper, joined at the top edge, for writing on: tập ghi chép
examples: a plain/ruled notepad
a reporter's notepad

children.name: volume
children.definition: a book: cuốn sách
examples: While still an undergraduate, his first slim volume 'Fighting Terms' enjoyed a considerable success.
volume of
a volume of Keats’s poetry

children.name: bookshop
children.definition: bookstoreUS  a shop where books are sold: hiệu sách

children.name: library
children.definition: a room or building containing books that can be looked at or borrowed:
examples: a public library

children.name: go to/visit the library
examples: I need to go to the library to return some books.

children.name: use the library
examples: You can use the library before or after school.

children.name: borrow something from the library/take something out of the library
examples: Books, CDs, DVDs, and magazines can be borrowed from the library.

children.name: return something to the library/take something back to the library
examples: Have you taken those books back to the library?

children.name: check something out of the libraryAmerican English
children.definition: borrow a book etc from the library
examples: You can check out up to ten books from the library.

children.name: a public library
children.definition: a library that is supported by government money
examples: Our public libraries need more support.

children.name: a school/university/college library
examples: She was studying at the college library.

children.name: a local library
examples: This information is available at your local library.

children.name: a lending library
children.definition: one that lends books
examples: Lending libraries became increasingly popular in Victorian times.

children.name: a reference library
children.definition: one that does not lend books, so that you must read them there
examples: The reference library contains a collection of documents relating to slavery.

children.name: a research library
children.definition: one that is good for doing research
examples: The university has one of the best research libraries in the world.

children.name: a branch library
children.definition: a small library that is controlled by a larger library
examples: There is a good children's section in the branch library.

children.name: a mobile libraryBritish English
children.definition: a small library inside a vehicle
examples: A mobile library visits the village once a week.

children.name: a library book
examples: She's gone into town to change her library books.

children.name: a library card
children.definition: a card that proves you are a member of a library and can borrow books
examples: When you join the library, you will be issued with a library card.

children.name: a library user
examples: Library users have been protesting against plans to close the local library.

children.name: the library staff
examples: If you have problems finding a book, ask a member of the library staff.

children.name: library services
examples: Public library services are threatened by budget cuts.

children.name: a library catalogue
examples: Students need to be taught how to use the computerized library catalogue.

children.name: cover
children.definition: the outer front or back part of a magazine, book etc: bìa
examples: His photo’s on the cover of ‘Newsweek’ again.
front/back cover
an advertisement on the back cover
Ireadthe magazinefrom cover to cover(= all of it).
cover photo/shot/picture(= picture on the front cover)
The cover shot was of three guys in army kit.
a cover designthe cover design of the Christmas issue

children.name: the front/back cover
examples: The price of the book is on the back cover.

children.name: a hard/soft cover
examples: I never buy books in hard cover – they’re much more expensive.

children.name: a book/magazine cover
examples: There was a blonde girl on the magazine cover.

children.name: a cover story
children.definition: the main story on the front of a newspaper or magazine
examples: Last month’s cover story was entitled ‘Your Child’s Brain’.

children.name: a cover photo/shot
children.definition: picture on the front cover
examples: The picture became the July 4th cover shot.

children.name: a cover girl
children.definition: an attractive girl whose photo is on the front cover
examples: She had always liked the idea of being a cover girl.

children.name: read sth from cover to cover
children.definition: read a book, magazine etc very thoroughly
examples: He read it from cover to cover in less than three hours.

children.name: page
children.definition: (written abbp)one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc,
examples: The full address is givenon page15.
You will find the answersover the page.

children.name: the next/previous page
examples: I glanced back to the previous page.|What’s on the next page?

children.name: the opposite/facing page
examples: See the diagram on the opposite page.

children.name: the left-hand/right-hand page
examples: The answers are on the right-hand page.

children.name: the front/back page
children.definition: of a newspaper
examples: Her picture was on the front page of every newspaper.

children.name: the sports/arts/financial etc pages
children.definition: the part of a newspaper that deals with sport, art etc
examples: He only ever reads the sports pages.

children.name: a blank page
children.definition: with nothing on it
examples: There were a couple of blank pages at the back of the book.

children.name: a new/fresh page
children.definition: which has not yet been written on
examples: Start each section of your essay on a new page.

children.name: a full page
examples: The article went on for a full page.

children.name: turn a page
examples: I turned the page in order to find out what happened next.

children.name: turn to/see page 22/45 etc
examples: Turn to page 8 for more details.

children.name: flick/flip/leaf through the pages of sth
children.definition: turn them quickly
examples: She was flicking through the pages of a magazine.

children.name: jump/leap off the page
children.definition: be very noticeable
examples: One mistake jumped off the page.

children.name: the top of the page
examples: Write your name at the top of the page.

children.name: the bottom/foot of the page
examples: See the note at the bottom of page 38.

children.name: a 400-page novel
examples: We took out afull page advertisementin the ‘Village Voice’.

children.name: margin
children.definition: the empty space at the side of a page: lề
examples: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.

children.name: wide
examples: The margin should be wider.

children.name: narrow
children.definition: not wide
examples: The margins are very narrow, making the page look cluttered.

children.name: a generous margin
children.definition: wide
examples: Leave a generous margin at the side of the page.

children.name: the right-hand margin
children.definition: on the right of the page
examples: There were some notes written in the right-hand margin.

children.name: the left-hand margin
children.definition: on the left of the page
examples: All typing begins at the left-hand margin.

children.name: leave a margin
examples: The teacher told us to leave a margin wide enough for him to write corrections.

children.name: set the margins
children.definition: make them a particular size
examples: Set the margins to have one inch on each side.

children.name: in the margin
examples: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
If I have any comments to make, I'll write them in the margin.

children.name: bibliography
children.definition: a list of all the books and articles on a particular subject, or all the books and articles that are used when you write something: danh mục
examples: ▪ There is a short bibliography at the back of the book.

children.name: in a bibliography trong một danh mục
examples: ▪ Details of suggested further reading are given in the bibliography.

children.name: chapter
children.definition: (written abbchap.) one of the parts into which a book is divided: chương
examples: Read Chapter 11 as your homework.
This chapter discusses power, and how people use it.

children.name: this chapter/the present chapter
examples: The present chapter deals with the years leading up to the war.

children.name: the next chapter
examples: This theme will be developed in the next chapter.

children.name: the following chapters
children.definition: the ones after this one
examples: The following chapters will explore this issue.

children.name: the previous/preceding chapter
examples: The method is described in the previous chapter.

children.name: earlier chapters
children.definition: the ones before this one
examples: All these have been mentioned briefly in earlier chapters.

children.name: later chapters
children.definition: the ones after this one
examples: These points will be explored in more detail in later chapters.

children.name: the introductory/opening chapter
children.definition: the first chapter
examples: There’s a short introductory chapter giving an outline of the subject matter.

children.name: the last/final chapter
examples: The final chapter summarizes the themes in the book.

children.name: be divided into chapters
examples: The book is divided into ten chapters.

children.name: read a chapter
examples: I haven’t even read the first chapter yet.

children.name: write a chapter
examples: He wrote the first chapter 20 years before the book was published.

children.name: see chapter 2/3 etc
children.definition: used in books to direct a reader to a chapter
examples: His scientific claims were never justified (see chapter 16).

children.name: be discussed/described in chapter 1/2/3 etc
examples: These points will be discussed in chapter 8.

children.name: a chapter deals with something
examples: Three further chapters deal with soil, water, and air.

children.name: a chapter explores something
examples: The second chapter explores the effects of these changes in more detail.

children.name: a chapter is devoted to something
children.definition: it deals only with a particular subject
examples: Five whole chapters are devoted to social reform.

children.name: the beginning/start of a chapter
examples: His character is introduced at the beginning of the first chapter.

children.name: the end of a chapter
examples: The answers are given at the end of the chapter.

children.name: the remainder of a chapterformal
children.definition: the rest of a chapter
examples: The remainder of this chapter is devoted to a discussion of privatization.

children.name: contents
children.definition: the things that are written in a letter, book etc
examples: The letter was burned and its contents will never be known.

children.name: contents page
examples: Sue opened the book and looked at the contents page.

children.name: contents of
examples: A computer disk can store the entire contents of a set of encyclopedias.
The contents of the report are expected to show that the government acted wrongly.
She kept the contents of the letter a secret.

children.name: table of contentsa list of what a book contains
examples: She glanced at the table of contents to see what stories were included.

children.name: The program automatically creates a table of contents
examples: He cast his eye down thecontents page.

children.name: introduction
children.definition: / introinformal a written or spoken explanation at the beginning of a book, speech etc: lời giới thiệu lời tựa
examples: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
Mr Brown gave a brief introduction to the course.
Have you read the introduction to the third edition?

children.name: index
children.definition: an alphabetical list, such as one printed at the back of a book showing which page a subject, name, etc. is found on: bảng chú dẫn
examples: It’s a lot quicker if you use the index.

children.name: in the index
examples: Try looking up 'heart disease'inthe index.
Look under B in the index to see if biology is covered in the book.

children.name: text
children.definition: a book or other piece of writing that is connected with learning or intended for study: văn bản
examples: Some of the original text has survived.

children.name: set text(= one that must be studied for an examination)
examples: ‘Hamlet’ is a set text this year.
'Ulysses' is a set text for the exam.
Literary texts, like all other works of art, have a historical context.

children.name: artwork
children.definition: the pieces of art, such as drawings and photographs, that are used in books, newspapers, and magazines: phần tranh ảnh minh họa
examples: We are still waiting for the artwork to come back from the printers.
All the artwork in the book has been done by the author.
